form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend section 203 of the Federal Power Act.

section.text: Section 203(a)(1)(B) of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 824b(a)(1)(B)) is amended by striking such facilities or any part thereof and inserting such facilities, or any part thereof, of a value in excess of $10,000,000.
Section 203(a) of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 824b(a)) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this paragraph, the Commission shall promulgate a rule requiring any public utility that is seeking to merge or consolidate, directly or indirectly, its facilities subject to the jurisdiction of the Commission, or any part thereof, with those of any other person, to notify the Commission of such transaction not later than 30 days after the date on which the transaction is consummated ifâ€”

clause.text: such facilities, or any part thereof, are of a value in excess of $1,000,000; and
such public utility is not required to secure an order of the Commission under paragraph (1)(B).

subparagraph.text: In establishing any notification requirement under subparagraph (A), the Commission shall, to the maximum extent practicable, minimize the paperwork burden resulting from the collection of information.

section.text: The amendment made by section 1 shall take effect 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives June 12, 2017.
